qas.question: Are supply side solar technologies generally active or passive?
Are demand side solar technologies generally active or passive?
What is an active solar technique used to generate energy?

answers.text: designing spaces that naturally circulate air

qas.question: What does an active solar technique do?
What does a passive solar technique do?

answers.text: reduce the need for alternate resources

context: <a0_0>Active<a0_0/> solar techniques use photovoltaics, concentrated solar power, solar thermal collectors, pumps, and fans to convert sunlight into useful outputs. <a1_0>Passive<a1_0/> solar techniques include selecting materials with favorable thermal properties, <a2_0>designing spaces that naturally circulate air<a2_0/>, and referencing the position of a building to the Sun. Active solar technologies <a3_0>increase the supply of energy<a3_0/> and are considered supply side technologies, while passive solar technologies <a4_0>reduce the need for alternate resources<a4_0/> and are generally considered demand side technologies.
